result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla H Chevalier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.
All financials same as noted above.
Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

Provide a DNA sample.  
Absolute sobriety.  No entry into Class B licensed establishments.  
No contact with Brad Tatro or Headquarters.
